main_definition: The Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers (IEEE) is a professional association dedicated to the advancement of technology, science, and innovation in electronics and electrical engineering.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An acronym for The Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers
meanings_and_examples.example: The IEEE was founded to support the development and dissemination of technology.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A prestigious organization that publishes various technical standards, journals, conferences, and professional certifications in fields related to electrical engineering and electronics
meanings_and_examples.example: Many engineers choose to become IEEE members to access these resources.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An international honor society for students pursuing a career in the field of engineering, particularly electronic or electrical engineering
meanings_and_examples.example: The student chapter of IEEE at XYZ University is highly active and offers various scholarships to its members.
